metadata.Title: CVE-2015-5185 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The lookupProviders function in providerMgr.c in sblim-sfcb 1.3.4 and 1.3.18 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (NULL pointer dereference and application crash) via an empty className in a packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5185` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

sfcb - 1.4.6-0ubuntu4
sfcb-test - 1.4.6-0ubuntu4
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sblim-sfcb package in xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.4.6-0ubuntu4').
